perturbation.original_text: 2.5 SERVICE PERFORMANCE OF INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM.  The parties each shall in good faith work to provide reasonable service levels with respect to the operation of the portions of the Information Transfer Mechanism in their control.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.5 SERVICE PERFORMANCE OF INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM. The parties each may try to provide service levels with respect to the operation of the portions of the Information Transfer Mechanism in their control.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall in good faith work to provide reasonable service levels' with 'may try to provide service levels' introduces ambiguity, making the obligation to provide service levels discretionary rather than mandatory. This contradicts basic contract law principles requiring parties to fulfill their contractual obligations in good faith.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract - Good Faith Performance (Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing)

perturbation.original_text: i-Escrow will comply with all laws and regulations and act as an Independent Escrow Agent as per the guidelines of California Escrow Law (California Financial Code Section17000 et seq., or its successor).  Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement conflict with the California Escrow Law, its rules or regulations, which govern i-Escrow's business practices, the California Escrow Law shall prevail. Notwithstanding the foregoing, at any time that i-Escrow reasonably believes such a conflict exists, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart written notice of such conflict and the parties will use their best efforts to resolve such conflict.
perturbation.changed_text: i-Escrow will generally attempt to comply with most applicable laws and regulations and act as an Independent Escrow Agent. Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement potentially conflict with any interpretation of California Escrow Law, i-Escrow may notify 2TheMart, and the parties can attempt to resolve such potential conflict.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'will comply with all laws and regulations' to 'will generally attempt to comply with most applicable laws and regulations' introduces a significant ambiguity regarding the extent of i-Escrow's compliance obligations. Replacing 'California Escrow Law shall prevail' with 'i-Escrow may notify 2TheMart, and the parties can attempt to resolve such potential conflict' makes the adherence to California Escrow Law non-mandatory, thereby contradicting the specific requirements set forth in the California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq. (California Escrow Law)

perturbation.original_text: Each party shall hold the other party's Confidential Information in confidence and shall not disclose such Confidential Information to third parties nor use the other party's Confidential Information for any purpose other than as required to perform under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party should endeavor to hold the other party's Confidential Information with reasonable care, and will attempt not to disclose such Confidential Information to third parties, or use the other party's Confidential Information for any purpose other than as deemed necessary.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall hold the other party's Confidential Information in confidence' to 'should endeavor to hold the other party's Confidential Information with reasonable care' weakens the obligation to protect confidential information. Similarly, replacing 'shall not disclose' with 'will attempt not to disclose' and 'as required to perform under this Agreement' with 'as deemed necessary' introduces subjectivity and ambiguity to the restrictions on disclosure and usage of confidential information. This contradicts standard requirements for the protection of trade secrets and confidential information, as it does not create a clear obligation for maintaining confidentiality.
